column1: The election is not over and I encourage everyone to remain patient as the final votes are counted. We must see that the results are accurate the process is transparent and that all legal votes are counted. We must remain vigilant in this critical time in our democracy.

We're back! Haley Patton and I had a blast this morning reminding everyone to vote absentee before 5:00 p.m. today. If you plan to vote in person the polls are open 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. on Tuesday. Make your plans to vote! https://t.co/tCzo6ebpYv

Haley & I were honored to help welcome our latest Mississippi Republican Party chairman Frank Bordeaux to his new role. Under his leadership we will see our party continue to do great things and help ensure Mississippi remains one of the most conservative states in the union. https://t.co/5yJiHaEKTt
.@realDonaldTrump showed our nation why he is the best choice to lead the country. Republicans grew the strongest economy in years under his leadership. We will do it again.

I'm honored to be named a friend of business during my first term. I've worked hard to promote Mississippi businesses and I will continue to do my part to see that Mississippi continues to grow and offer opportunities for everyone who calls our state home. https://t.co/NR7JfNNPYc

Last night @Mike_Pence reminded the American people that the economy law and order are on the ballot in November. @SpeakerPelosi  is now telling Joe Biden to avoid the debates in order to hide his position on the issues important to the American people. https://t.co/azyGE8H4i3

Kamala Harris stands shoulder to shoulder with the most liberal Senators.   With Biden’s pick for VP the Democrats have embraced the radical left.   The American people are not interested radicalism.   We want real solutions to support law enforcement & reopen our economy.
There are regulations in some areas in the district that limit the number of days we can display campaign material but we will let you know when it’s time to show your support again!
Thanks to everyone who put out a yard sign in support of our campaign. If you still have one please take it down & hold on to it for the general election in November.

THANK YOU for the confidence you’ve placed in me to be your Republican nominee for Congress again this year! Haley and I are humbled and grateful for your support in today’s election. I’ll continue working in… https://t.co/k56PXXGr0J

Just about 3 hours left until the polls close at 7:00 p.m. today. If you haven’t voted yet please make sure your voice is heard in this election. I would be honored to have your vote! https://t.co/RDYC5dIaPt

Polling places are now open for voting from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m today. I’m asking for your vote so I can continue representing our conservative values in the United States Congress. Please vote today. Thank you! https://t.co/CHCWXgJkOv
Thank you President Donald J. Trump for your endorsement and support in tomorrow’s election! https://t.co/SdUykbjoHn

Congress is in session during Election Day tomorrow so I’ll be there doing the job you hired me to do. I would be honored to have your vote tomorrow. Haley and I filmed a quick video from our favorite spot to wave… https://t.co/vHhXIwl0ds
Please join us tomorrow night at 6:00 p.m. for an Election Eve BBQ at the Brandon Civic Center as we prepare for Election Day. https://t.co/7EGvRMu273

Just a reminder that today at 12:00 noon is the last day to vote by absentee ballot at your circuit clerk’s office. If you’re going to be out of town this Tuesday please be sure to vote today. Thank you! https://t.co/72wfNXewJI
Please join us on Monday at 6:00 p.m. for an Election Eve BBQ at the Brandon Civic Center as we prepare to get-out-the-vote! https://t.co/IRHqQE0wcL
I’m asking for your vote this Tuesday March 10 and we can send a message that Mississippi still believes in the conservative values of faith family and freedom. https://t.co/WmOLgidXR1

With just 24 hours left to vote by absentee ballot since I will be working for you and voting in Congress this Tuesday I just voted at my circuit clerk’s office. If you’re going to be out of town this Tuesday… https://t.co/294VDLHoaH

The absentee ballot voting deadline is just 48 hours away. If you’re going to be out of town on March 10 please vote by absentee ballot by noon this Saturday. With your vote I’ll keep fighting for you and our… https://t.co/ayWarxsnP7

I’m running on my record working on your behalf and voting in Congress for conservative policies to strengthen our economy rebuild our military and secure our borders. I would be honored to have your vote on March 10. https://t.co/LAscRKAQK6

Tonight Haley enjoyed attending A Night With Harry honoring Harry Mayer sponsored by the Meridian Rotary Club and the East Mississippi Development Foundation. The event benefited the Mississippi Children’s Museum Meridian. Congratulations to Mr. Harry Mayer. https://t.co/9LpDPXQYYN

Today Haley and my mother enjoyed being part of the Mississippi Federation of Republican Women’s Legislative Day 2020 at the State Capitol. Thank you to all of the Republican Women’s groups across the state for… https://t.co/4Rc0JimDhE

Haley my mother my mother-in-law and my sister all enjoyed being at the Madison County Republican Women’s meeting tonight. Thanks for your hospitality and for helping us spread the word about the March 10… https://t.co/gbIUR2weXk
I hope everyone has a restful Sunday with your family this nice Spring day that reminds us of the wonders of God’s creation. https://t.co/jnZtWuXvvm

If you’re going to be out of town on March 10 you can vote TODAY by absentee ballot at your circuit clerk’s office until 12:00 noon. Thank you to all of our volunteers for helping spread the word about the… https://t.co/2IbwZUJopF

Human trafficking is an issue that is prevalent in our state and nation. Thank you to the volunteers churches and first responders in our state who are doing their part to address human trafficking. Find out how you can help by going to https://t.co/tzPNElkoLQ. https://t.co/goDncwIiLl
If you haven’t signed up for campaign e-mail updates yet please go to https://t.co/wwVF1Csy50  so you can stay updated with all campaign news and activities. https://t.co/uDlbmpeBmB

The national Democrats are in complete chaos and it’s a sign of how they’d govern if elected. That’s why we’ve got to have a big turnout March 10 and again on November 3 to support President Trump and take a stand… https://t.co/lTSofkXPYU

Election Day is just 2 weeks from today! Please remind your family and friends to vote — and if you’re going to be out of town on March 10 you can vote by absentee ballot between now and March 7 at noon by… https://t.co/xlTRi4PxhK

I enjoyed being part of the event earlier today to welcome new Republicans to the msgop. Every year the Democrat Party moves further to the left and away from the values of Mississippians. The Republican Party is… https://t.co/45l5KqTSzJ
Haley and I enjoyed attending the Lincoln County Republican luncheon today. We are thankful for these women and men who work hard for our state and party. https://t.co/ya8TNDmXuA
Our family enjoyed attending An Evening in Maroon with Coach Jackie Sherrill last night. I would like to congratulate Dr. Tommy Byrd on being named Alumnus of the Year. https://t.co/azC9tXlPpF
I’m honored to be endorsed by the NRA in this election and I will always support our 2nd Amendment rights. https://t.co/8zDziNrLDr

I’d like to thank the Mississippi State University College Republicans for inviting me to speak last night! I am impressed by these future leaders of our state and their passion for strong conservative principles. https://t.co/k1cBgdr6b4

Election Day is just three weeks away. Please remind your family and friends about the importance of voting and if you’re going to be out of town you can still vote by absentee ballot. https://t.co/BgkLZUuuFZ

My mother and mother-in-law joined the Covington County Republican Women today for lunch at Morgan’s. We are thankful for these great women and all that they do for the Republican Party. https://t.co/s1amrtY1IF
Haley and I are looking forward to being at the meeting of the MSU College Republicans on Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. https://t.co/27lxS0cmXh
I want to wish my bride a happy Valentine’s Day. Haley has been a great wife and I have been blessed to have her by my side for the last 22 years. https://t.co/RpGUFA3k3S

Haley and I shared a few laughs with him last Saturday while he was preparing to entertain at his last Dixie National Rodeo an event that he made special every year. We will continue to pray for his loved ones and join his many fans in remembering his gift of creating laughter.
Lecile Harris brought many years of joy to our state. He was a kind-hearted man and will be remembered for creating thousands of smiles. https://t.co/KKrNrCET91
Haley and my mother-in-law had a great time in Simpson County today visiting with people at Granny’s Table for lunch. Thank you for your support and hospitality! https://t.co/x7iru2KS9V
I’m very honored to receive the True Blue Award from the Family Research Council as we work together on important issues to all families in Mississippi and our country. https://t.co/ckqPFSHcbT
I'm honored to be endorsed by @bullybloc in this year's election. Thank you for your support! https://t.co/X6GX53pXG6

Haley ran into some great ladies at the Madison County Republican Women’s meeting tonight. We’re grateful for the hard work of this organization to make our state and party stronger. https://t.co/H4AIjkZOzV
As the father of an Eagle Scout it was an honor to address the Troop 8 Court of Honor yesterday at First Baptist Jackson and welcome eight new scouts to the rank of Eagle. https://t.co/VUqnt1cF6q

Election Day — March 10 — is only 1 month away! That’s during Spring Break week so if you’re planning on being out of town that day please vote by absentee ballot before you leave by contacting your circuit clerk’s office. You can vote by absentee ballot through March 7 at noon.

Haley & I enjoyed being part of the Dixie National Rodeo in Jackson last night. Thank you @CommAndyGipson for your hospitality & leadership. It was law enforcement appreciation night honoring Brad Sullivan & that made it an extra special meaningful & all around great event. https://t.co/Wx7cgV7DL7
I’m very honored to receive the endorsement from MMA as they represent thousands of people who are working hard across our state to make our economy stronger every day.

While in Brookhaven Haley and I made sure to stop and visit with some very important first responders our fire fighters. Thank you to the brave men and women across our state who respond to disaster and work every day to keep our communities safe. https://t.co/7c2O0ShuJp

Haley my mother and mother-in-law were in Meridian yesterday and stopped by the Daily Grind Coffee Club. It is always great to see our friends in Meridian. I am blessed to have Haley constantly working in the district while I am in DC. https://t.co/RafXKgEzqK

While in Starkville Haley and I joined friends to celebrate Dr. Ruby’s 81st birthday. Dr. Ruby served as Vice President of Student Affairs at Mississippi State and other positions including interim president for 40 years. Happy birthday Dr. Ruby! https://t.co/9ivHnn806v

Yesterday I met with business owners and local citizens interested in the economic development and growth of Pike County. Mississippi businesses will continue to thrive under common sense economic policies of lower taxes and fewer regulations. https://t.co/5b3o9cNyTk
I’m honored to receive an A rating in the just released Susan B. Anthony List’s New Pro-Life Scorecard. I will always fight to protect the right to life of the unborn. https://t.co/y00nGkexxU
Team Guest is back on the road. My dad Pat and my father-in-law Tom are putting up our campaign signs around the district today. https://t.co/cq8icsW5Tw
